title: Fix cargo build lock contention - give each polecat its own target dir
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Currently all polecats share the same cargo target directory, causing builds to serialize and block each other.

**Problem:**
- Polecats wait for file lock on build directory
- Only one polecat can build at a time
- Severely impacts parallel work throughput

**Solution:**
Set CARGO_TARGET_DIR environment variable per polecat worktree to give each its own isolated build directory.

**Implementation:**
Option 1: Add to polecat .claude/settings.json env vars
Option 2: Add to polecat spawn logic in gt
Option 3: Use .cargo/config.toml per worktree

**Files:**
- Either: pixelsrc/polecats/.claude/settings.json (if env var approach)
- Or: Gas Town polecat spawn code (if gt handles it)
- Or: .cargo/config.toml template per polecat

**Verification:**
- Spawn 3 polecats
- All 3 run cargo build in parallel
- No 'waiting for file lock' messages
notes: Added CARGO_TARGET_DIR to polecat session startup in session_manager.go. Each polecat now gets CARGO_TARGET_DIR=<worktree-path>/target set when the session starts, isolating cargo builds and preventing file lock contention.

title: Fix hair coverage on reference-head - too much skin visible
description:
The hair styles in reference-head.pxl don't provide enough coverage - too much skin is visible beneath/around the hair.

Issues observed:
- Hair polygons don't extend far enough down the sides of the head
- Gap between hair and face where skin shows through
- Hair needs to cover more of the forehead and temples

Affected sprites:
- hair_short
- hair_long  
- hair_mohawk
- hair_ponytail
- hair_curly

Fix approach:
- Extend hair polygons to cover more of the head ellipse
- Ensure hair overlaps properly with face at the hairline
- Adjust z-ordering if needed to ensure hair renders on top of skin at edges

File: examples/iso-prototype/reference-head.pxl

title: Fix: Duplicate sprite name warning
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Gap from phase-0-gaps.md:

Spec requirement (docs/spec/format.md - Error Handling):
- Duplicate name  Last definition wins  Warning: 'Duplicate sprite name X, using latest'

Current behavior: Both sprites rendered, no warning.

Required fix in src/cli.rs:
1. Track seen sprite names in a HashSet
2. When duplicate detected:
   - Lenient mode: warn and skip (keep first, not last per spec clarification)
   - OR warn and replace (keep last per spec)
   - Strict mode: error and fail

Verification:
```
./target/release/pxl render tests/fixtures/lenient/duplicate_name.jsonl -o /tmp/dupe.png 2>&1 | grep -i warning
```
Should show: Warning: Duplicate sprite name 'dupe', using latest
close_reason: Implemented duplicate sprite name detection with warning. Latest definition wins in lenient mode, fails in strict mode.

Sprites that use the 'source' field to reference another sprite show a warning:
"Sprite X has no regions defined (add structured regions format to the sprite)"

This is incorrect because sprites using 'source' inherit regions from the source sprite - they don't need their own regions.

Example:
```json
{"type": "sprite", "name": "head_base_redhead", "source": "head_base", "palette": "head_pal_redhead"}
```

The sprite inherits regions from 'head_base' but validator warns it has no regions.

File: examples/iso-prototype/reference-head.pxl (lines 902, 914, 922)

title: var() inside color-mix() fails CSS parsing
description:
When using var() references inside color-mix(), the CSS parser fails with 'unexpected token: Ident("var")'.

Example that fails:
```json
"skin_hi": "color-mix(in oklch, var(--skin) 40%, white)"
```

The var() function works standalone but not when nested inside color-mix().

Reproduction:
1. Create a palette with CSS variables like `"--skin": "#d8b088"`
2. Reference with color-mix: `"skin_hi": "color-mix(in oklch, var(--skin) 40%, white)"`
3. Run `pxl validate`

Expected: var() should be resolved before color-mix() is parsed
Actual: CSS parse error: unexpected token: Ident("var")

File: examples/iso-prototype/reference-head.pxl

title: Remove legacy grid format references
description:
Systematic removal of all references to the deprecated grid format in favor of the regions format.

## Background
The grid format (`"grid": ["{a}{b}", "{c}{d}"]`) has been replaced by the regions format 
(`"regions": {"name": {...}}`). Many test strings, comments, and some production code still 
reference the old format.

## Scope
1. Production code that exports/parses grid format
2. Test strings throughout the codebase  
3. Documentation and comments

## Files Identified
- src/import/mod.rs - to_jsonl() exports grid
- src/cli.rs - grid parsing in CLI
- src/lsp_agent_client.rs - grid detection
- src/lsp.rs - test strings
- src/models.rs - test strings
- src/registry.rs - test strings
- src/color.rs - comment examples
- tests/wasm_tests.rs - test constants
- tests/demos/ - demo test files

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] No remaining "grid" field references in production code
- [ ] All test strings use regions format
- [ ] All comments/docs updated
- [ ] All tests pass
